summary.span: 表示包含子項目集合的組態項目。

span.span: Represents a configuration element containing a collection of child elements.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 表示組態檔內的項目集合。The represents a collection of elements within a configuration file. > [!NOTE] > 組態檔內的項目是指基本的 XML 項目或一節。An element within a configuration file refers to a basic XML element or a section. 如果有的話，簡單的項目是與相關屬性的 XML 標記。A simple element is an XML tag with related attributes, if any. 簡單的項目構成一節。A simple element constitutes a section. 複雜的區段可以包含一或多個簡單的項目中，元素的集合，以及其他區段。Complex sections can contain one or more simple elements, a collection of elements, and other sections. 您使用若要使用的集合物件。You use the to work with a collection of objects. 實作這個類別，以新增自訂的集合項目。Implement this class to add collections of custom elements to a . ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用。The following example shows how to use the . 第一個範例包含三個類別： `UrlsSection`，`UrlsCollection`和`UrlConfigElement`。`UrlsSection`類別會使用定義自訂組態區段。The first example consists of three classes: `UrlsSection`, `UrlsCollection` and `UrlConfigElement`.The `UrlsSection` class uses the to define a custom configuration section. 這個區段包含 URL 的集合 (所定義`UrlsCollection`類別) 的 URL 項目 (由`UrlConfigElement`類別)。This section contains a URL collection (defined by the `UrlsCollection` class) of URL elements (defined by the `UrlConfigElement` class). [!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.configuration.configurationelementcollection/cs/customcollectionsection.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.configuration.configurationelementcollection/vb/customcollectionsection.vb#1)] 此第二個程式碼範例會使用前面所指定的類別。This second code example uses the classes specified before. 您結合這兩個範例中的主控台應用程式專案。You combine these two examples in a console application project. [!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection#31](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.configuration.configurationelementcollection/cs/usingconfigurationcollectionelement.cs#31)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection#31](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.configuration.configurationelementcollection/vb/usingconfigurationcollectionelement.vb#31)] 當您執行主控台應用程式的執行個體`UrlsSection`類別建立與應用程式組態檔中產生下列的組態項目：When you run the console application, an instance of the `UrlsSection` class is created and the following configuration elements are generated in the application configuration file: ```

span.para: 您可以使用程式設計方式或宣告式 (attributed) 程式撰寫模型來建立自訂的組態項目。程式設計模型需要針對每個項目屬性您建立的屬性來取得及設定其值，而且您將它新增至基礎的內部屬性包基底類別。宣告式模型，也稱為屬性化的模型，可讓您藉由使用屬性並將其設定與屬性定義元素屬性。這些屬性會指示 ASP.NET 組態系統有關的屬性類型和其預設值。ASP.NET 可以使用反映，來取得這項資訊再建立項目屬性的物件，並執行必要的初始化。

You can use a programmatic or a declarative (attributed) coding model to create a custom configuration element. The programmatic model requires that for each element attribute you create a property to get and set its value, and that you add it to the internal property bag of the underlying base class. The declarative model, also referred to as the attributed model, allows you to define an element attribute by using a property and configuring it with attributes. These attributes instruct the ASP.NET configuration system about the property types and their default values. ASP.NET can use reflection to obtain this information and then create the element property objects and perform the required initialization.

summary.span: 在衍生類別中覆寫時，將 加入 執行個體。

span.span: Adds a to an instance when overridden in a derived class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法來加入新至集合。Use the method to add a new to the collection. 如果自訂行為時，務必在新增的項目，衍生類別中覆寫。Override in a derived class if custom behavior is required when the element is added. 新增項目時，只有在索引鍵完全相同而值不同時，才會將項目視為重複。When adding, an element is considered a duplicate only if the keys are identical but the values are different. 索引鍵和值都完全相同的項目是以無訊息模式接受，因為項目不會競爭。Elements with identical keys and values are accepted silently because the elements do not compete. 但是不能新增具有完全相同索引鍵而不同值的項目，因為沒有邏輯可決定在兩個競爭的值當中應該接受哪一個。However, an element with an identical key but a different value cannot be added because there is no logic to determine which of the competing values should be honored.

span.para: 如果您建立自訂集合，其中包含異質性類型，您必須執行下列步驟:-覆寫方法。 -確定所方法會傳回字串，識別您藉由呼叫所建立之項目的型別方法。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 當您新增重複的項目時，如果將擲回例外狀況元素的值是或。When you add a duplicate element, an exception is thrown if the value of the element is either or . 請注意，具有相同索引鍵和值的項目不被視為重複項目，並以無訊息方式接受。Note that elements with identical keys and values are not considered duplicates, and are accepted silently. 唯一的項目擁有相同的金鑰，但不同的值會被視為重複。Only elements with identical keys but different values are considered duplicates. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 < 備註 > 一節方法。For more information, see the Remarks section for the method.

.method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance void Unmerge(class System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement sourceElement, class System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement parentElement, valuetype System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode updateMode) cil managed

param.name: sourceElement
param.span: 目前層級上的 物件，包含屬性的合併檢視。

span.span: A object at the current level containing a merged view of the properties.

param.name: parentElement
param.span: 目前項目的父 物件，如果位於最上層，則為 。

span.span: The parent object of the current element, or if this is the top level.

summary.span: 抵銷從不同組態階層架構層合併組態資訊的影響

span.span: Reverses the effect of merging configuration information from different levels of the configuration hierarchy

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法會回復從組態階層架構的不同層級合併組態資訊的效果。The method reverses the effect of merging configuration information from different levels of the configuration hierarchy. 這允許在序列化之前，在目前階層架構層級上設定的組態可以設定為與不同於父層級上的設定。This allows configuration set at the current hierarchy level to be differentiated from that set at parent levels, before serialization. 會呼叫新的暫存項目，以比較父物件與來源物件上的系統。 is called by the system on a new temporary element to compare the parent object and the source object. 根據值，然後將暫存物件，以包含必須序列化的資料。Based on the value, it then sets the temporary object to contain the data that needs to be serialized. 如需詳細資料儲存模式，請參閱。For details about save modes, see .
